intro: Elytrigia ninae, commonly known as the NINA grass, is a flowering plant species native to the high-altitude regions of the Tibetan Plateau. It belongs to the grass family, Poaceae, and is characterized by its slender, tufted growth habit with narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant produces small, spikelet-based inflorescences that contain both male and female flowers, typical of many grasses. Elytrigia ninae is adapted to cold and arid environments, showcasing resilience to harsh climatic conditions. Its ecological role includes contributing to soil stabilization and serving as a food source for local wildlife.
